snippet: While the overwhelming majority of the responses on social media and elsewhere were positive, there were also a number of people who expressed doubts.
abstract: Gravity Payments chief executive Daniel J Price's announcement that he will cut his million-dollar salary to $70,000 a year to help finance raises for more than half of his 120-person staff invites flurry of activity on social media; some say move is shrewd, while critics call it foolish.
lead_paragraph: While the overwhelming majority of the responses on social media and elsewhere were positive, there were also a number of people who expressed doubts.

headline.main: Praise and Skepticism as One Executive Sets Minimum Wage to $70,000 a Year
headline.print_headline: One Firm’s Annual Pay of $70,000 Stirs Debate
